NEWS LETTER
Elaine DeLack is a multi-talented, energetic and determined woman who, faced with a crippling disease that threatened to destroy her and her family, set out to unravel its mechanism of action, and then counter its effects with a formulation of her own design. Along the way, she ran headlong into an unthinking, hidebound and profit-oriented medical establishment determined to preserve its place in the hierarchy of patient care, and the privilege and power that come with that position. Her story is one of determination, perseverance and integrity in the face of hostility, suspicion and outright abuse. If you didn’t have an opinion about organizations like the National MS Society before, you certainly will, as I did, after reading this book. Moreover, you will have an abiding admiration for Elaine, who never strayed from the path she started out on, and ultimately realized her goal of being able to help others cope with this maddening and discouraging disease.
–Douglas. J. Wilson, R.P.Bio., P.Ag.
